title.narrative: Partnership for Maternal, Newborn, Child Health P2

description.narrative: The Partnership for Maternal, Newborn, Child Health (PMNCH) is a global alliance of over 400 members working towards achievement of Millennium Development Goal (MDG) 4 to reduce child mortality and MDG5 to improve maternal health. Funding under this initiative represents Australia core funding support to PMNCH, with particular interests in: increasing the focus on Asia Pacific region; encouraging PMNCH's work in building an investment case for maternal and child health; supporting implementation of and monitoring commitments under the Global Strategy; and ensuring Australia's investment in maternal and child health is coordinated with others to maximise the benefits to those most in need. The total value of this initiative is $5.5 million over 4 years, starting 2011-12.
